title: 114_hr6248
content: The "Spending Safeguard Act" is the short title of the Act. It includes a spending limitation on direct spending programs. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates the establishment of a spending limitation for direct spending programs by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget within 90 days of enactment or reauthorization. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates a spending limitation for direct spending programs, with different percentages based on the budget function. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates a spending limitation for direct spending programs based on budget functions. The cost of the program is determined by the Director using scorecards or estimates under the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Director is required to maintain and make publicly available a spending safeguard limitation scorecard. The Spending Safeguard Act requires a spending limitation for direct spending programs based on budget functions. The Director maintains a spending safeguard limitation scorecard displaying spending levels for these programs. The Secretary of the Treasury must report monthly costs for each program listed on the scorecard. Treasury must report total spending for direct spending programs on the scorecard to the Director. The Director submits a biannual report to Congress on spending levels and their relation to the spending safeguard limitation. President's budget submissions are required annually. The Spending Safeguard Act requires the President to include in annual budget submissions a report on the total spending for direct spending programs subject to spending safeguard limitations. This report must also detail the relationship between the spending level and the applicable safeguard limitation. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates the President to report on total spending for direct spending programs subject to limitations. If a program is projected to breach the spending safeguard within six months, a report must be submitted within 15 days. The Director must report to Congress if a direct spending program is projected to exceed the spending safeguard within six months. If the program reaches the limitation, funds cannot be obligated for it after 30 days. The Director must report to Congress if a direct spending program is projected to exceed the spending safeguard within six months. If the program reaches the limitation, funds cannot be obligated for it after 30 days, and a report must be submitted to the relevant committees. Any Federal agency implementing a listed program must ensure compliance with the obligation limitation. The spending program listed on the scorecard must inform participants about a spending safeguard limitation that could affect future fund availability. Definitions in the Act include the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the meaning of "direct spending." The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 defines terms related to direct spending programs and prohibits new authorization of funding for the Act.
